Pre-Game Insights: Bangladesh are struggling to be a serious contender, having lost three games - to England, New Zealand and India - after an opening victory against Afghanistan.
South Africa have scored 300-plus every time they have batted first in this World Cup - with their top order laying a strong platform for a powerful finish.

Klaasen and Mushfiqur will be in the spotlight: Klaasen will undoubtedly be a hot topic at the Bangladesh team meeting after his 109 off 67 balls against England at the Wankhede, an innings that was played in the gruelling afternoon heat and humidity of Mumbai.
Shakib missed the game against India with a left quadriceps injury but he said he trained without issues on Sunday and is likely to be fit for the game.
Post-Match Reflections: South Africa are comfortably placed at No. 3 in the points table. And their thumping margins of victories - 102 runs against Sri Lanka, 134 against Australia, and 229 against England - have earned them the best net run rate in the tournament.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The batting line-up, especially in Shakib's absence, could do with Mushfiqur at No 4 but he is unlikely to move up the order.
Expect another hot afternoon with temperatures in the mid-30 celsius with high humidity.
Bangladesh have outplayed South Africa in two of their three World Cup matches, in Providence (2007) and at The Oval (2019).
Klaasen's strike-rate of 147.95 this year is the second highest among batters who have scored more than 700 runs in ODIs.
Others: Temba Bavuma and Shakib Al Hasan will be assessed on the morning of the game to determine their fitness.
Taskin Ahmed remains unavailable because of a shoulder injury.
Bangladesh have won an away ODI series against South Africa for the first time in 2022.
